hints.label: def-quantum-canonical-ensemble
hints.title: Quantum Canonical Ensemble
hints.content:
3214: :label: def-quantum-canonical-ensemble
3215: 
3216: For a quantum system with Hamiltonian $\hat{H}$, the canonical ensemble at inverse temperature $\beta = 1/(k_B T)$ is:
3217: 
3218: $$
3219: \hat{\rho}(\beta) = \frac{e^{-\beta \hat{H}}}{Z(\beta)} \quad \text{where } Z(\beta) = \text{Tr}(e^{-\beta \hat{H}})
3220: $$
3221: 
3222: is the quantum partition function.
3223: 
3224: **Properties**:
3225: - Hermitian: $\hat{\rho}^\dagger = \hat{\rho}$
3226: - Positive semidefinite: $\hat{\rho} \geq 0$
hints.raw_directive:
3211: ## 7.1 Quantum Density Matrix Geometry
3212: 
3213: :::{prf:definition} Quantum Canonical Ensemble
3214: :label: def-quantum-canonical-ensemble
3215: 
3216: For a quantum system with Hamiltonian $\hat{H}$, the canonical ensemble at inverse temperature $\beta = 1/(k_B T)$ is:
3217: 
3218: $$
3219: \hat{\rho}(\beta) = \frac{e^{-\beta \hat{H}}}{Z(\beta)} \quad \text{where } Z(\beta) = \text{Tr}(e^{-\beta \hat{H}})
3220: $$
3221: 
3222: is the quantum partition function.
3223: 
3224: **Properties**:
3225: - Hermitian: $\hat{\rho}^\dagger = \hat{\rho}$
3226: - Positive semidefinite: $\hat{\rho} \geq 0$
3227: - Normalized: $\text{Tr}(\hat{\rho}) = 1$

hints.label: def-bures-metric
hints.title: Bures Metric (Quantum Fisher Information)
hints.content:
3232: :label: def-bures-metric
3233: 
3234: The **Bures metric** on the space of density matrices is the quantum analogue of the Fisher information metric:
3235: 
3236: $$
3237: g_{\text{Bures}}^{ij}(\theta) := \frac{1}{2}\text{Tr}\left[\hat{\rho}(\theta) \{\hat{L}_i, \hat{L}_j\}\right]
3238: $$
3239: 
3240: where:
3241: - $\hat{L}_i := \frac{\partial \log \hat{\rho}}{\partial \theta^i}$ is the **quantum score operator** (symmetric logarithmic derivative)
3242: - $\{A, B\} := AB + BA$ is the anticommutator
3243: 
3244: **Alternative formula** (for non-degenerate $\hat{\rho}$):
3245: 
3246: $$
3247: g_{\text{Bures}}^{ij} = 2\sum_{m,n} \frac{(\langle m | \partial_i \hat{\rho} | n \rangle)(\langle n | \partial_j \hat{\rho} | m \rangle)}{\rho_m + \rho_n}
3248: $$

hints.label: thm-quantum-ruppeiner-metric
hints.title: Quantum Ruppeiner Metric
hints.content:
3254: :label: thm-quantum-ruppeiner-metric
3255: 
3256: The quantum Ruppeiner metric is:
3257: 
3258: $$
3259: g_R^{ij} = -\frac{\partial^2 S}{\partial U^i \partial U^j}
3260: $$
3261: 
3262: where $S = -\text{Tr}(\hat{\rho} \log \hat{\rho})$ is the von Neumann entropy.
3263: 
3264: For the canonical ensemble in the **thermodynamic limit** ($N \to \infty$):
3265: 
3266: $$
3267: g_R^{\beta\beta} = \text{Var}(\hat{H}) = \text{Tr}(\hat{\rho} \hat{H}^2) - (\text{Tr}(\hat{\rho} \hat{H}))^2
3268: $$
3269: 
3270: For **finite systems**, there are $O(1)$ corrections from higher energy cumulants, but these vanish in the thermodynamic limit by the quantum central limit theorem.
3271: 
3272: **Notational note**: This is the Ruppeiner metric in $(\beta, V, N)$ parameter space, related to the metric in $(U, V, N)$ energy space by the coordinate transformation $g_R^{UU} = (\partial \beta/\partial U)^2 g_R^{\beta\beta}$.

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-65
hints.content:
3277: :::{prf:proof}
3278: 
3279: **Step 1**: Quantum entropy derivative.
3280: 
3281: Using $\hat{\rho} = e^{-\beta \hat{H}} / Z$, the von Neumann entropy has the form:
3282: 
3283: $$
3284: S = -\text{Tr}(\hat{\rho} \log \hat{\rho}) = \beta \langle \hat{H} \rangle + \log Z
3285: $$
3286: 
3287: **Step 2**: First derivative.
3288: 
3289: Taking the derivative:
3290: 
3291: $$
3292: \frac{\partial S}{\partial \beta} = \langle \hat{H} \rangle + \beta \frac{\partial \langle \hat{H} \rangle}{\partial \beta} + \frac{\partial \log Z}{\partial \beta}
3293: $$
3294: 
3295: Using the standard statistical mechanics identity $\frac{\partial \log Z}{\partial \beta} = -\langle \hat{H} \rangle$:
3296: 
3297: $$
3298: \frac{\partial S}{\partial \beta} = \beta \frac{\partial \langle \hat{H} \rangle}{\partial \beta}
3299: $$
3300: 
3301: **Step 3**: Second derivative.
3302: 
3303: $$
3304: \frac{\partial^2 S}{\partial \beta^2} = \frac{\partial \langle \hat{H} \rangle}{\partial \beta} + \beta \frac{\partial^2 \langle \hat{H} \rangle}{\partial \beta^2}
3305: $$
3306: 
3307: Using the quantum fluctuation-dissipation theorem $\frac{\partial \langle \hat{H} \rangle}{\partial \beta} = -\text{Var}(\hat{H})$:
3308: 
3309: $$
3310: \frac{\partial^2 S}{\partial \beta^2} = -\text{Var}(\hat{H}) + \beta \frac{\partial}{\partial \beta}[-\text{Var}(\hat{H})]
3311: $$
3312: 
3313: **Step 4**: Evaluate the variance derivative.
3314: 
3315: For the canonical ensemble with Hamiltonian $\hat{H}$ having temperature-independent eigenvalues $\{E_n\}$ (the standard case), the variance derivative is:
3316: 
3317: $$
3318: \frac{\partial \text{Var}(\hat{H})}{\partial \beta} = -\text{Cov}(\hat{H}, \hat{H}^2) + 2\langle \hat{H} \rangle \cdot \text{Var}(\hat{H})
3319: $$
3320: 
3321: This is $O(\beta^{-1} \cdot \text{Var}(\hat{H}))$ from the cumulant expansion, giving:
3322: 
3323: $$
3324: \beta \frac{\partial \text{Var}(\hat{H})}{\partial \beta} = O(\text{Var}(\hat{H}))
3325: $$
3326: 
3327: Therefore:
3328: 
3329: $$
3330: \frac{\partial^2 S}{\partial \beta^2} = -\text{Var}(\hat{H}) \cdot [1 + O(1)]
3331: $$
3332: 
3333: **Important note**: The $O(1)$ correction depends on higher cumulants (third moment of energy) and is system-dependent. For the Ruppeiner metric, we use the **canonical definition**:
3334: 
3335: $$
3336: g_R^{\beta\beta} := -\frac{\partial^2 S}{\partial \beta^2} = \text{Var}(\hat{H}) \cdot [1 + O(1)]
3337: $$
3338: 
3339: In the **thermodynamic limit** ($N \to \infty$, $V \to \infty$, $N/V$ fixed), higher cumulants become negligible relative to the variance (central limit theorem), yielding:
3340: 
3341: $$
3342: \lim_{N \to \infty} g_R^{\beta\beta} / \text{Var}(\hat{H}) \to 1
3343: $$
3344: 
3345: **Step 5**: Coordinate transformation.
3346: 
3347: With $U = \langle \hat{H} \rangle$, the Jacobian $\partial \beta / \partial U = -\beta^2 / C_V^{\text{quantum}}$ transforms:
3348: 
3349: $$
3350: g_R^{UU} = -\frac{\partial^2 S}{\partial U^2} = \left(\frac{\partial \beta}{\partial U}\right)^2 \left(-\frac{\partial^2 S}{\partial \beta^2}\right) = \frac{\beta^4}{(C_V^{\text{quantum}})^2} \cdot \text{Var}(\hat{H})
3351: $$
